newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentina has carried out debt buyback of $377 mln.
newsitem.headline: Argentina has carried out debt buyback of $377 mln.

text.p: Argentina has carried out a debt buyback of $377 million of Bonex 92 bonds, the government said in its daily official bulletin Tuesday.
The central bank made the purchase at the average market price on March 21, the bulletin said. On March 21 the bond closed at a price of $70.85.
The buyback was financed with 1.5 billion marks of seven-year bonds that were placed in February.

"The purchase will result in an improvement in the debt profile by extending its duration, and at the same time will lead to a reduction in the net debt because of the decline in the bonds bought back," the bulletin said.
Prior to the buyback there was $1.875 billion outstanding of the Bonex 92, which is a floating rate note maturing on Sept 15, 2002.
Economists have been anticipating a debt buyback in light of recent statements by government officials on the topic.
